abstract: With a petition to the F.C.C. and a letter to Congressional leaders, cable and satellite providers said the current rules were “broken and in need of repair.”
snippet: With a petition to the F.C.C. and a letter to Congressional leaders, cable and satellite providers said the current rules were “broken and in need of repair.”
lead_paragraph: Trying to prevent the kind of brinkmanship that had ABC removing its affiliate station from millions of New York area homes hours before the Oscar broadcast, a group of television providers asked the government Tuesday to revamp the rules governing the retransmission of stations.

headline.main: New Rules Sought on TV Retransmission
headline.print_headline: New Rules Sought on TV Retransmission

abstract: Comcast doesn’t sign a petition asking the government to change station retransmission rules.
snippet: Comcast doesn’t sign a petition asking the government to change station retransmission rules.
lead_paragraph: Many of the country’s biggest television providers have signed on to a petition asking the government to revamp station retransmission rules. Cablevision, Charter, DirecTV, Dish Network, Time Warner Cable and Verizon all joined the coalition of providers and nonprofit groups in signing the petition on Tuesday.

headline.main: Comcast Is Absent From Campaign to Change Retransmission Rules
